alert.note: Alert for Macon; Sumter (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Macon, northwestern Dooly and northeastern Sumter Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 520 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Hicks to Bartlett to Andersonville, and moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Oglethorpe, Montezuma, Byromville, Andersonville, Lilly, Dooling, Whitewater State Park, Fountainville, Flint River Wma, Pennington, Andersonville National Historic, Clearview, Winchester, and Bartlett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and west central Georgia.
